title: Common Cents and Gold and Silver Commemorative Coin Act; enact.
subject: Finance

actions.description: Title Suff Do Pass Comm Sub

extras.summary: AN ACT TO BE KNOWN AS THE "COMMON CENTS AND GOLD AND SILVER COMMEMORATIVE COIN ACT"; TO AUTHORIZE MUNICIPAL GOVERNMENTS, COUNTY GOVERNMENTS, AND STATE AGENCIES TO ROUND THE TOTAL AMOUNT DUE FOR CERTAIN FEES, FINES, CHARGES, AND TAXES TO THE NEAREST 10¢ WHEN PAID IN CASH, IN ORDER TO ADDRESS LIMITED AVAILABILITY OF ONE-CENT COINS; TO PROVIDE UNIFORM ROUNDING RULES; TO REQUIRE THAT ROUNDING BE APPLIED ONLY TO THE FINAL AMOUNT DUE AFTER ALL CALCULATIONS; TO PROVIDE THAT NONCASH PAYMENTS SHALL CONTINUE TO BE SETTLED TO THE CENT; TO REQUIRE RECORDKEEPING AND PUBLIC NOTICE; TO REQUIRE EACH GOVERNMENTAL ENTITY TO ADOPT A POLICY DETERMINING WHETHER IT SHALL ROUND ACCORDING TO THE AUTHORITY GRANTED TO IT UNDER THIS SECTION; TO REQUIRE ANY ENTITY CHOOSING TO ROUND TO APPLY ITS ROUNDING POLICY UNIFORMLY; TO AUTHORIZE RULEMAKING; TO AUTHORIZE THE STATE TREASURER TO ENTER INTO A CONTRACTUAL AGREEMENT WITH A PUBLIC OR PRIVATE MINTING COMPANY FOR THE PURPOSES OF MINTING ONE-OUNCE GOLD STATE COMMEMORATIVE COINS OR ONE-OUNCE SILVER COMMEMORATIVE COINS FOR THE STATE OF MISSISSIPPI; TO AMEND SECTIONS 25-3-21, 25-7-65, 27-15-153, 27-17-423, 27-19-81, 27-25-1, 27-31-79, 49-19-115, 65-1-46, 65-33-47, 69-7-263 AND 69-10-5, MISSISSIPPI CODE OF 1972, TO CONFORM; AND FOR RELATED PURPOSES.
